intro: Xanthostemon vieillardii, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its bark is smooth and greyish. Xanthostemon vieillardii is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
